intro: Pluchea senecioides, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks and wetlands, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and blue to purple in color. Pluchea senecioides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
